     Search
Was Joe Biden caught on video calling a girl ‘one sexy kid’?
============================================================
By  March 28, 2024 
*   
We came across the following post on the social media platform X:
!
The post includes what appears to be a video, taken on a phone, of the US president speaking to a supporter, who seems to be a girl or a young woman.
From the audio, Biden appears to say, “Let me whisper you a secret. You’re one sexy kid. Don’t tell mommy what I told you. You got it?”
The president then poses with the girl, before she informs him that she is in fact recording the interaction, to which Biden reacts with surprise.
The audio therefore appears to implicate the president with sexual harassment of a minor.
### **Altered Audio**
When we did a search on the comments attributed to Biden in the video, we found that it was an altered version of the original, and a similar claim with a different altered version had been debunked by  in October 2023.
Politifact indicated that the original video was recorded at a , where Biden signed an executive order ‘aimed at advancing economic security for military families’. They also included a link to a  uploaded on 10 June 2023, which they indicated was the original video.
The video, by creator saucedofamily, appears to show that the ‘girl’ featured is actually a mother who is carrying a baby. The baby cannot be seen in the altered version, which is cropped.
In the original video, it is clear that Biden is speaking to the child, while referring to the woman carrying the child as the mother in his comments.
The audio does not record Biden saying, ‘You’re one sexy kid,”. However, the rest of the audio is the same as in the altered video.
!
!
The creator also claims that the comments the president made were audible to her, and that he told her baby that ‘he will be the first Mexican president’.
Politifact reported that an altered version of the video had  in October 2023, where it has been flagged by Politifact and the Portuguese factchecker Poligrafo.
We therefore find the claim that Biden made inappropriate comments towards a girl or young woman...[Content truncated]

website_quality_evaluation.justification: While Black Dot Research focuses on providing reports regarding misinformation and fact-checking, it may not have the same level of recognition or credibility as the larger, more established organizations mentioned above. Its approach can be beneficial, but it lacks widespread acknowledgment and a comprehensive track record.

Relevance.Relevance Justification: This evidence provides context on the claim and confirms that it was based on altered audio. However, it takes a more roundabout route to conclude that the original audio does not support the claim, hence receiving a relatively moderate score.

Query1.title: False claims of 'deepfake' President Biden go viral
Query1.snippet: Jul 28, 2022 ... People are falsely claiming a video of US President Joe Biden posted by the Democratic Party is a deepfake. A deepfake is a video created ...

content.content:
People are falsely claiming a video of US President Joe Biden posted by the Democratic Party is a deepfake.
A deepfake is a video created using artificial intelligence to show someone saying or doing something they didn't do.
We've looked into the video.
Social media users have claimed the video has been altered to superimpose the president's face on an actor's body using artificial intelligence. 
In the 17-second clip President Biden speaks about the 6 January riots which saw protesters storm the US Capitol building. The riot is currently being investigated by a congressional panel.
The video was published on the Democrats' official Twitter account on Wednesday, and quickly became part of a wider conspiracy theory.
Posts doubting the legitimacy of the video have been shared thousands of times, including by prominent pundits from the right-wing US television channels Newsmax and One America News. 
One reason people have cast doubt on the video is because they say President Biden looks different in another video published on the same day - which some people have also claimed is fake.
But the differences in his appearance are clearly due to the lighting used when filming.
People have also claimed the video is suspicious because he doesn't blink - but that wouldn't prove the video was a deepfake.  
One post that has been retweeted almost 40,000 times says "a normal person blinks their eye...[Content truncated]

website_quality_evaluation.justification: The British Broadcasting Corporation (BBC) is known for its high journalistic standards and accuracy in reporting. It covers a wide array of topics globally and is often cited for its reliable news. The BBC has established a strong reputation for impartiality and thorough reporting.

Relevance.Relevance Justification: While it discusses a viral video and misinformation involving Biden, it does not specifically confirm or deny the phrase in question. Its relevance is lower due to the lack of direct connection to the specific claim.

Query2.title: Analysis: Biden's disastrous debate pitches his reelection bid into ...
Query2.snippet: Jun 28, 2024 ... If Joe Biden loses November's election, history will record that it took just 10 minutes to destroy a presidency.

content.content:
If Joe Biden loses November’s election, history will record that it took just 10 minutes to destroy a presidency.
    

            It was clear a political disaster was about to unfold as soon as the 81-year-old commander in chief stiffly shuffled on stage in Atlanta to stand eight feet from ex-President Donald Trump at what may turn into the most fateful presidential debate in history.
    

Related article
Takeaways from CNN’s presidential debate with Biden and Trump


            Objectively, Biden produced the weakest performance since John F. Kennedy and Richard Nixon started the tradition of televised debates in 1960 — then, as on Thursday, in a television studio with no audience.
    

            Minutes into the showdown, hosted by CNN, a full-blown Democratic panic was underway at the idea of heading into the election with such a diminished figure at the top of the ticket.
    

            Biden’s chief debate coach, Ron Klain, famously argues that “while you can lose a debate at any time, you can only win it in the first 30 minutes.” By that standard, the president’s showing was devastating. The tone of the evening was set well before the half hour.
    

            It is too early to say how voters will respond and whether the president can rescue himself. But Biden barely beat Trump in key battleground states in the middle of a pandemic in ...[Content truncated]

website_quality_evaluation.justification: CNN is a well-established news outlet with extensive coverage of national and international events. While it strives for accuracy, it has faced critiques regarding bias and sensationalism in its reporting. Despite this, CNN employs professional journalists and fact-checkers, making it a generally reliable source for news.

Relevance.Relevance Justification: This analysis of a debate performance has no connection to the claim about Biden's alleged comment. Therefore, it holds no relevance to the current question.

Query2.title: Six takeaways from the Biden-Trump presidential debate | US ...
Query2.snippet: Jun 28, 2024 ... Former US President Donald Trump, 78, hurled hyperbole at President Joe Biden ... “You are a child,” responded Biden. Trump called Biden a ...

content.content:
[Content truncated]... flat against his more bombastic opponent, especially during the early stages of the debate. Later on, Biden somewhat picked up the pace to push back against Trump’s slew of factually incorrect assertions about immigration and abortion.
However, Democrats raised the alarm over Biden’s performance, with some even starting to talk about replacing him on the presidential ticket.
“There are going to be discussions about whether he [Biden] should continue,” David Axelrod, former senior adviser to former President Barack Obama, told CNN.
While Biden’s Vice President Kamala Harris backed him after the debate, saying substance matters over style in this election, even she conceded “it was a slow start”.
 

 
Biden and Trump went back and forth over which of them is physically and cognitively stronger.
Trump boasted about his strength, claiming, “I’m in as good shape as I was 25, 30 years ago,” to moderators Jake Tapper and Dana Bash.
In response, a snickering Biden implied his opponent was lying about both his height and weight.
Trump said he had won two championships on his golf course while Biden “can’t hit the ball 50 yards”.
This prompted Biden to challenge Trump to a golf match, only if Trump would carry his own bag.
“Let’s not act like children,” said Trump.
“You are a child,” responded Biden.
 

 
“We are the biggest producer of support for Israel of anyone in the world,” Biden said, reiterating US support for Israel’s war on Gaza in which more than 37,718 Palestinians have been killed since October last year.
Biden added that his administration is continuing to send experts and intelligence to hinder Palestinian group Hamas in the war.
Trump snapped back, saying it is Israel that wants to continue with the war, “and you should let them go, and let them finish the job. He [Biden] doesn’t want to do it. He’s become like a Palestinian, but they don’t like him because he’s a very bad Palestinian, he’s a weak one”.
In the nearly nine months of the war that has left Gaza rife with power outages and food insecurity, the United States has provided military and diplomatic assistance to Israel, and has repeatedly blocked ceasefire resolutions. A US-sponsored resolution endorsing a ceasefire proposal eventually only passed at the United Nations Security Council (UNSC) some eight months into the war.
 

 
Trump invoked anti-abortion sentiment by accusing Biden and his party of allowing late-term abortions.
During the debate, Trump claimed Biden and...[Content truncated]

website_quality_evaluation.justification: Al Jazeera is a respected global news network that provides in-depth coverage of international affairs. It is known for offering perspectives that may be undervalued by Western media, but it can also reflect biases based on its geographical and cultural context. Overall, it’s a credible source for a fuller view of world events but may require cross-referencing with Western outlets for balance.

Relevance.Relevance Justification: This article also discusses a debate between Biden and Trump, with no mention of the specific claim about Biden's alleged remarks. It offers no relevant context.

Query2.title: Lankford Reacts to Biden's State of the Union Address - Senator ...
Query2.snippet: Mar 8, 2024 ... WASHINGTON, DC – Senator James Lankford (R-OK) tonight reacted to President Joe Biden's State of the Union address to the nation. Excerpts. I ...

content.content:
**to watch Lankford’s remarks on YouTube.**
**WASHINGTON, DC –** Senator James Lankford (R-OK) tonight reacted to President Joe Biden’s State of the Union address to the nation.
**Excerpts**
_I’m Senator James Lankford. It is late tonight after the State of the Union address. I was sitting in the State of the Union Address which is really more of a campaign speech tonight than it was the State of the Union address. I’ve sat in quite a few State of the Union addresses now, and I’ve watched a lot from home as well. I’ve never seen one that was a pure campaign speech the whole time start to finish where President Biden continued to compare himself to “my predecessor.” I guess he wouldn’t say the name Trump the whole time and so it was just continual “my predecessor, my predecessor.” He never did compare some basic stats with quote unquote his “predecessor” like how many people illegally crossed the border during “his predecessor” and how many people are illegally crossing the border now, or what the strength of the economy was five years ago versus what it is now. He didn’t do those side by sides, but he found other ways to be able to drive it and while he talked a little bit about trying to unify the country, the speech was absolutely the most divisive speech I’ve ever heard during a State of the Union address. From the very beginning it was...[Content truncated]

website_quality_evaluation.justification: This is the official website of U.S. Senator James Lankford. As an official government site, it can provide insights regarding legislative actions or statements made by the senator. However, it may contain political biases and primarily represent the senator’s viewpoints. While it can be somewhat reliable for information related to the senator's statements, it should not be the sole source for unbiased news.

Relevance.Relevance Justification: This evidence is a reaction from a senator to a State of the Union address and similarly does not pertain to the claim regarding Biden's remark to a child. It does not provide clarity or verification regarding the specific quote.

QA.Question: Is there verified evidence of Joe Biden actually saying, 'You're one sexy kid' in the video?
QA.Answer: No, there is no verified evidence that Joe Biden actually said, "You're one sexy kid" in the video. The claim originates from an audio snippet that has been analyzed and determined to be altered. According to a source, Biden appears to be heard saying, "Let me whisper you a secret. You’re one sexy kid. Don’t tell mommy what I told you. You got it?" However, this audio has been confirmed to be part of a modified version of the original content, where context and intent have been misrepresented. Further investigation by Politifact indicated that the claims involving Biden's comments were taken out of context. In the original video, he is engaging with a woman who is carrying a child, and the implications of inappropriate comments are attributed to an audio alteration that cropped out the mother, altering the perception of the interaction. The evidence collectively suggests that not only is the claim based on an altered audio but that responsible fact-checking has debunked the notion of Biden making such a statement inappropriately. Given this analysis, I would rate my confidence in this conclusion at 95%.
